item.title: A Different Amazon Show May Have Just Given God of War Its Best Possible Kratos Actor
item.description:
God of War is getting a live-action series on Amazon Prime, and while the show is likely a while away right now, it's a compelling prospect. Over the years, God of War has quickly become one of the most influential franchises in gaming, and that success has led to a series adaptation.

Right now, there's no official cast set in stone for the God of War series, but one of the biggest questions is who will play Kratos. Finding the perfect actor for Kratos is definitely no easy task, but thanks to the recent third season of Reacher , the best actor possible may have been introduced. Dutch bodybuilder Olivier Richters played the role of Paulie in Season 3 of Reacher , and he may just have what it takes to bring Kratos to life.

Spoilers ahead for Reacher Season 3.

Reacher Season 3's Finale May Have Opened the Door for a Great Kratos Actor

Paulie Was a Juggernaut Who Met an Early End

  • Paulie dies fighting Reacher in the season finale.

Reacher and Paulie going head-to-head was like watching two beasts fighting. Like two tanks, Reacher and Paulie put up a strong fight, but the former ultimately got the upper-hand, killing Paulie. As a character, Paulie had potential as a long-running villain, but his exit from the show could actually be far better in the long run. Olivier Richters is a hulking individual, and it's easy to imagine him taking on the role of God of War 's demigod protagonist.

Season 4 of Reacher has been confirmed.

Olivier Richters' Stats

Height

7 feet, 2 inches

Weight

350lb

Age

35

He's clearly built like a demigod, so it wouldn't take too much imagination to find him believable as Kratos. Whoever is cast as Kratos in the show needs to be able to put up a good fight. Kratos is a powerful fighter, and the brutal showdown between Paulie and Reacher could be a fascinating preview of what a live-action Kratos fight could look like. With his stature and physicality, Olivier Richters seems like a shoo-in for the role. Even better, his age is gold for casting directors. At 35, Richters could easily play Kratos for years.

It's already been teased that Amazon is thinking long-term about its God of War series. Showrunner Ronald Moore recently revealed that Amazon has already ordered two seasons of God of War . If Richters were to be cast, his age would make him a great choice if the show were to get several seasons beyond that.

God of War is far from the first video game to get a live-action series. HBO's second season of The Last of Us has just started, and season two of Fallout is currently filming.

Paulie's Death Could Be More Than it Seems

This is purely speculation, but it's possible that Paulie may have been killed because Amazon might already be eyeing Richters for the role. He's clearly already on their radar, since he's had a significant role in one of the streaming platform's most prominent shows. However, this could be thinking too far ahead. As interesting as Paulie is as a character, he meets a violent end in the books, as well, so his end was inevitable. Regardless, Richters now being a free agent is exciting, and his exit from Reacher will hopefully lead to bigger roles.

Right now, there's no way to know what the God of War show has in store. Live-action video game adaptations are all the rage right now, and with God of War already being a cinematic experience, it will be fascinating to see how the live-action series succeeds at making it feel fresh while also honoring the source material.

From Santa Monica Studio comes the sequel to the critically acclaimed God of War (2018). Fimbulwinter is well underway. Kratos and Atreus must journey to each of the Nine Realms in search of answers as Asgardian forces prepare for a prophesied battle that will end the world. Along the way they will explore stunning, mythical landscapes, and face fearsome enemies in the form of Norse gods and monsters. The threat of Ragnark grows ever closer. Kratos and Atreus must choose between their own safety and the safety of the realms.

item.title: Rumor: Genshin Impact Leaks Dahlia's Element, Weapon, and Rarity
item.description:
Summary

  • According to a leak, Dahlia is a 4-Star Hydro Sword character, with a focus on buffing Attack Speed.
  • Dahlia's addition could bring back older units, depending on his Attack Speed buff strength.

A recent Genshin Impact leak has revealed Dahlia as a 4-Star Hydro Sword character, with an ability kit that focuses on buffing Attack Speed. As Genshin Impact continues to finalize Escoffier and Ifa for Version 5.6, players have slowly been getting information about the final two characters of the Natlan era. While it would be wrong to say that HoYoverse has saved the best for last, both Dahlia and Skirk carry a lot of history, excitement, and even expectation.

Skirk in Genshin Impact has been talked about since Version 1.1, ever since Tartaglia introduced her as his mentor. She made her first in-game appearance in Version 4.2, and is now set to become a playable character in Version 5.7. From a gameplay standpoint, Skirk is a 5-Star Cryo Sword with a powerful ability kit that prioritizes Freeze teams. On the other hand, Dahlia was leaked two years ago as an upcoming Mondstadt character, and many Genshin Impact fans were wondering when HoYoverse would finally add him to the playable cast.

According to HomDGRat (now going by Kokomi), Dahlia will be a 4-Star Hydro Sword character. While his synergy with Skirk will be minimal, he is designed to be a Support character who grants buffs to Attack Speed. What makes Dahlia in Genshin Impact so exciting is that he will be the game's fourth Hydro 4-Star, as the roster previously only offered Candace, Xingqiu, and Barbara.

Genshin Impact: Upcoming Characters

  • Escoffier 5-Star Cryo Polearm
  • Ifa 4-Star Anemo Catalyst
  • Skirk 5-Star Cryo Sword
  • Dahlia 4-Star Hydro Sword

In terms of how Dahlia could affect the meta, it depends on two things: how strong his Attack Speed buff will be, and if he will offer any additional utility. A dedicated Attack Speed buffer would bring older units back into relevancy, such as Ayato, Yoimiya, or even Wanderer. However, as seen with Mika in Genshin Impact , it's not enough to only provide Attack Speed. Given that Hydro still doesn't have a true Shielder (not counting Traveler or Lan Yan), it could be a potential niche for Dahlia to fill.

The leak also revealed information about Skirk's signature weapon, claiming that it would provide bonuses to CRIT RATE, CRIT DMG, and ATK. While any details about its passives are unknown, on paper, it sounds like it could be a highly-coveted Signature Weapon, not unlike Mistsplitter Reforged. Thankfully, the changes made to Weapon Banners in Genshin Impact have simplified the process of obtaining a Signature Weapon, and HoYoverse has certainly been open about the idea of running stacked banners in the Natlan era. Version 5.7 is expected to come out on June 18, 2025.

item.title: Minecraft Player Shares Neat Atmospheric Structure Designs
item.description:
Summary

  • A Minecraft player creates new atmospheric structures that adds more character to each biomes.
  • Structures made of existing blocks could realistically be integrated into the game's natural biomes.

A talented Minecraft fan online has shared their impressive atmospheric structure designs that they'd like to see added to the game's natural biomes. These unique Minecraft designs could be used to add even more character to each biome in the game.

Across Minecraft 's long lifespan, fans have never been shy about sharing their own ideas for the game. After all, Mojang can't come up with all the good ideas, so sometimes these community suggestions are a great starting point for the developer. Sometimes, players create working proof-of-concepts of these ideas in-game, while at other times, they produce them outside the game. Just recently, another Minecraft player shared an awesome idea for a volcano biome concept, which would be a complete change of pace from what players are currently used to.

Redditor tedude3 shared their impressive Minecraft creation, after making different structures that fit thematically with each biome, suggesting that they could be added as naturally spawning entities in the world. Each structure is made using existing in-game blocks, so it would certainly be plausible. It just helps to add a little bit of character to each area. The player even thought about how each one could be integrated into the game to make them feel like a realistic part of the Minecraft world.

Minecraft Atmospheric Structures Add Character To Each Biome

For example, the bridge remnants only spawn in the lava oceans in Minecraft 's Nether, and could sometimes spawn with a chest to encourage players to interact with them. Then, there are swamp pillars, which could theoretically spawn in groups of one to five, while only spawning in swamp waters. Implementing these kinds of features is always easier said than done, but given the existence of randomly generated villages, it seems like it could be possible and would be a great addition to the game.

So long after its initial release, it's impressive that Mojang continues to release plenty of new content for the game. Older content is often updated, too, with Minecraft recently making big changes to leashes in a recent snapshot. Given its ongoing popularity, it seems as though there's no end in sight for Mojang's Minecraft support, especially if fans continue to share their own ideas for the game.

item.title: Honkai: Star Rail Leak Teases Next Character After Fate Collab
item.description:
Summary

  • Honkai: Star Rail leaks are teasing one of the first characters set to release after the sci-fi RPG's upcoming crossover with Fate/Stay Night.
  • The leak suggests that a new Ice character will be coming to Star Rail's roster, though the character's identity and Path could not be confirmed.
  • The long-awaited Fate/Stay Night crossover is heavily rumored to be adding two new playable characters, featuring both Saber and Archer.

A new leak from Honkai: Star Rail is hinting at the Element of one of the first playable characters set to release following the game's highly-anticipated collaboration with Fate/Stay Night . The sci-fi RPG from HoYoverse has added a plethora of new characters since the launch of its newest playable world of Amphoreus, introducing several new mechanics to the game. The new Remembrance Path added "Memosprites" as its core gimmick, revolving around powerful summons that can assist in both dealing damage and providing buffs. Now, one of the game's next characters is being teased.

One of the most highly-anticipated events for many fans of Honkai: Star Rail 's Amphoreus has been the long-awaited Fate/Stay Night crossover. HoYoverse officially revealed last year that the sci-fi RPG would be teaming up with the iconic Japanese multimedia franchise, with rumors heavily suggesting that both Saber and Archer will become playable. Recent leaks have even hinted at the release window for the collaboration, believed to be arriving during the Version 3.4 update. A new leak, however, is giving an idea of what will come after the collab.

Honkai: Star Rail Leak Hints at Upcoming Character's Element

A recent update shared by prominent HoYoverse leaker Sakura Haven is hinting at one of the next characters coming after Honkai: Star Rail 's Fate collab. According to the leak, following the release of Phainon and the Fate/Stay Night crossover, one of the next characters coming to Star Rail will be debuting as an Ice Element character. The post does not give any confirmation about who the next Star Rail character will be, nor does it give any information about the rumored character's Path. Given previous leaks, however, the unnamed Ice character is not expected to be released within Star Rail 's next two updates.

Honkai: Star Rail looks to have a plethora of exciting characters set to join the roster throughout its next few updates. HoYoverse has already confirmed Hyacine and Cipher as the two new playable five-star units coming to the game during the Version 3.3 update, with leaks also hinting at re-runs for The Herta and Aglaea. Version 3.4 is expected to welcome not only the previously-mentioned Fate/Stay Night collaboration, but also Phainon to the playable cast.

HoYoverse is rumored to be making multiple changes to Honkai: Star Rail in the near future beyond its expanding cast of characters. The Memory of Chaos game mode will reportedly receive a major buff during Version 3.3, seeing the endgame challenge's highest floors boasting even more powerful enemies. The RPG is also heavily rumored to be adding a new Weekly Boss during Version 3.3, alongside a refresh to the game's Battle Pass in Version 3.4. Honkai: Star Rail fans should have lots to look forward to from the sci-fi RPG coming soon.

item.title: Dying Light 2 Releases Major Spring Update
item.description:
Summary

  • Dying Light 2 update 1.22 rolled out in mid-April 2025.
  • The patch introduces new weapons, UX refinements, and co-op improvements, among other changes.
  • Dying Light 2 Developer Tools received a new Visual Mods tool that allows tinkerers to customize environment textures, as well as clothing and weapons.

Dying Light 2: Stay Human update 1.22 is now available for download. This release introduces new weapons, UX improvements, and Dying Light 2 co-op tweaks, among other novelties.

February 4 marked the third anniversary of Dying Light 2: Stay Human 's release. Polish developer Techland has been updating its open-world action RPG on a fairly regular basis ever since.

Continuing this trend, Techland released another Dying Light 2 update in mid-April 2025. Identified by version number 1.22, this patch introduces co-op and UX improvements, as well as some additional content. Dying Light 2 's recently returned Tower Raid mode has been updated with 27 new weapons, including a trio of Elemental Pistols. These additions aren't filler, but come with unique traits that can create new strategic advantages, thus encouraging players to experiment. Tower Raid rewards have also been updated, offering a variety of exclusive cosmetics and items, including the Breach outfit.

Dying Light 2 Update 1.22 Makes Claiming Tower Raid Rewards More Convenient

Techland has also refined the game's UX with the goal of making Tower Raid rewards more convenient to claim. As a result of these changes, it's no longer possible to miss out on unlocked items, as players now have the ability to claim unlocks at their own convenience. The 1.22 update also introduces some minor HUD tweaks that clearly communicate when new rewards are earned and thus available to claim.

The spring 2025 patch further refines Dying Light 2 co-op through a variety of tweaks and bug fixes. Enemy behavior issues stemming from player synchronization have been curtailed, while the HUD has been tweaked to offer clearer visual cues and an overall more streamlined information overview. The game's developer tools have also been updated with the addition of a visual mods tool that allows tinkerers to customize environment, weapon, and clothing textures. While the tool is currently exclusive to PC, it's planned to eventually make its way to the console versions of the game as well.

The 1.22 update marks the official start of Techland's ambitious 2025 roadmap for Dying Light 2 . Moving forward, the developer is planning a big summer event that it's framing as part of its celebrations of the series' 10th anniversary. A Halloween event is also on the agenda, together with a major fall update whose scope is expected to be comparable to the 1.22 patch. Another Dying Light 2 Winter Tales event is then planned for late 2025.

Dying Light 2: Stay Human Update 1.22 Patch Notes

Tower Raid new weapons and rewards

The latest patch introduces an expanded arsenal with the addition of 27 new weapons (including 24 Elemental Weapons and 3 Elemental Pistols you asked for as well), each offering unique capabilities and strategic advantages, encouraging players to explore and adapt their gameplay styles. In tandem with this, the rewards have been updated, offering an array of enticing exclusive skins and other items. Among these rewards, you can find a highly anticipated Breach outfit that allows you to roam the city with the first of the original Tower Raid skins.

Additionally, we've implemented several UX improvements to ensure a seamless reward experience. Players can now claim rewards at their convenience, eliminating the risk of missing out on unlocked items. Furthermore, we've enhanced communication on the HUD to clearly indicate when rewards are earned, ensuring that players are always informed about their progress and achievements.

Co-op improvements

In the Spring Update, youll experience a slew of enhancements designed to elevate your co-op experience. We have addressed and resolved various enemy behavior issues affected by synchronization between players. This intends to ensure smoother gameplay and reduced discrepancies, including the amount of enemies teleporting and lagging.

The HUD has also received substantial improvements, providing clearer visual cues and streamlined access to vital information, ultimately enhancing situational awareness with multiple players on screen.

We're not stopping here, though! The co-op feature remains a key focus, and we've been making steady progress on it over the past few months. Our commitment to enhancing it will continue into the future.

Visual Mods tool

Ever wished you could change a specific detail in Villedor? Add a splash of color here, or add a darker, moodier atmosphere there? Look no further as were thrilled to introduce a new visual mods tool to Dying Light 2 Developer Tools. Currently available for PC, it offers a wide range of customization options, allowing players to modify textures in the environment, on weapons and even clothing. While visual mods are only available on PC for now, were hard at work making them available on consoles soon to encourage the entire community to get even more creative!

Game Updates

Aside from all the big news from Update 1.22 above, weve also introduced the following fixes and improvements to the game:

Co-op

  • Fixed the issue with GRE Aberration teleporting in co-op during its mission
  • Fixed the issue with Volatiles occasionally teleporting between ground and higher surfaces
  • Fixed the issue with the van conversation not playing until all players are nearby during The Breakthrough quest

Tower Raid

  • Fixed the issue with Biters sometimes teleporting while traversing climbable objects, e.g., tables
  • Fixed the issue with Tower Raid achievements tracking the wrong kind of damage (blunt instead of slashing)
  • Fixed the issue with the slope on the upper part of the roof causing Virals and Biters to slide while in a frozen pose
  • Fixed the issue with the wardrobe not being moved for peers when the host is too far from them in co-op
  • Fixed the meshes of firearms found in chests
  • Fixed the issue where the player might become stuck when sliding between multiple tables and sofas

Gameplay

  • Fixed the issue with some ranged weapons and tools sound sometimes glitching when used during Parkour Shot
  • Fixed the issue with ragdolls sometimes not applying correctly when performing ground pound
  • Fixed the issue with the enemy not being synced properly during finishers in tight spaces
  • Fixed the issue of allowing players to get outside the elevator cabin

Technical

  • Fixed the issue with the Snake Warriors boots sometimes displaying Killer Krampus boots
  • Fixed the issue of audio sometimes missing in random parts of the cutscene right after skipping the prologue
  • Fixed the issue with the map sometimes showing only icons
  • Fixed various crashes
  • Fixed the issue when sometimes hanging from the metro wagon will cause Aiden to get sent into the air
  • Fixed the issue when the player receives less XP upon killing multiple enemies simultaneously
  • Fixed the issue with PS5 Haptic Feedback sometimes not working properly after performing specific actions
  • Fixed the issue where weapons would sometimes stay in the hands of the character model during various animations
  • Fixed the issue with some weapons missing shadows
  • Fixed the issue with the game crashing when the player continuously fast travels between metro stations
